meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Stuart Jacobson Tim Loges Amy Winograd Friedman Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #991.

td.p: Stuart Jacobson, a business associate originally from New York City
Tim Loges, an accountant director originally from Dayton, Ohio
Amy Winograd Friedman, a business librarian originally from Lexington, Massachusetts (whose 1-day cash winnings total $7,201)

tr.td: STATE CAPITALS
'60s SONGS
ART
SCIENCE
"C" HERE
THE ADDAMS FAMILY
(Alex: Notice the spelling, A-D-D-A-M-S, a reference of course to the television series.)

tr.td: Amy
Tim
Stuart

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Amy
Tim
Stuart
POETRY
SAINTS
AFRICA
ANCIENT QUOTES
MAIDEN NAMES
THE ADAMS FAMILY
(Alex: But in this case, only one "D"; and that means that all of these refer to the John Adams family...probably.)

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex [to Tim]: You had to do a lot of figuring, thinking about what happened in 1963. Books would\'ve been published and they become best sellers in \'64.)
TimWHO IS JFK?
$4,800
AmyWho was John F. Kennedy?
$1,701
StuartWho was JFK
$4,501
John F. Kennedy')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'In 1964, 5 of the top 10 nonfiction best sellers were by or about this man')

tr.td: BEST SELLERS
In 1964, 5 of the top 10 nonfiction best sellers were by or about this man
Amy
Tim
Stuart
3rd place: Royal Queen cookware
2nd place: A trip to New York City via Eastern Airlines
New champion: $12,401
Amy
Tim
Stuart

18 R
(including 1 DD),
4 W

(including 1 DD),
